definition: abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
a breed of horse/variant of 歡|欢[huan1]
to seek happiness elsewhere (euphemism for extramarital sex)/a bit on the side

sentences.english: A new love puts an old one to flight.
Soon Lianxiang discovered that Sangxiao had another sweetheart.
sentences.chinese: 不久，莲香发现桑晓另有新欢。

sentences.english: You prove how much you love someone by confessing all that old stuff.
sentences.chinese: 你得通过承认那些旧爱，来证明你对新欢的爱有多深。

sentences.english: He abandoned his wife and children for another woman.
I love them not, how can new love to?
sentences.chinese: 旧爱不去，新欢怎么能来？

sentences.english: We broke up over a year ago because he was cheating on me.
sentences.chinese: 我们一年前就分了，原因是他有了新欢啊喂。

sentences.english: The insights of how many people like something aren’t enough.
sentences.chinese: 光是有知道多少人新欢某样东西的洞察力是不够的。

sentences.english: Be off with the old love before you are on with the new.
sentences.chinese: 你开始新欢之前得结束旧恋。

sentences.english: She'd left me for another, it's a common tale but true.
sentences.chinese: 她离开我另觅新欢，这是个寻常而真实的故事。

sentences.english: Is she your sweetheart, I love not old.
sentences.chinese: 她是你的新欢，我连旧爱都算不上。

sentences.english: Peter threw Ann over for a new girl friend.
sentences.chinese: 彼得抛弃了安另结新欢。

sentences.english: The man shamelessly abandoned his wife and child for another woman.
sentences.chinese: 那个男人无耻地抛弃了妻儿，另觅新欢。

sentences.english: Least if she didn't want me, she would see her new bloke in graveyard first.
sentences.chinese: 如果她不爱我了，她至少要到墓地才能看见她的新欢。

sentences.english: Her new sweetheart, my old love.
But two person of each one forgets in a moment, in addition has sought the new joy.
sentences.chinese: 而转眼间两人就各自相忘，另寻了新欢。

sentences.english: Old love new love becomes not a gesture of love.
sentences.chinese: 新欢成了旧爱爱的没了姿态。

definition: to do the splits (gymnastics)/(Tw) two-timing (in romantic relationships)/Taiwan pr. [pi1 tui3]
to seek happiness elsewhere (euphemism for extramarital sex)/a bit on the side
change of affection, shift of love (idiom); to change one's feelings to another love/to fall in love with sb else
to part company/to split up/to break up
derailment (railway accident)/to leave the rails/fig. to overstep bounds/fig. to have an extramarital affair
to lose one's love/to break up (in a romantic relationship)/to feel jilted
to fall head over heels in love/to be passionately in love
lit. lotus roots may break, but the fiber remains joined (idiom); lovers part, but still long for one another
